column13: Pumpkin bisque is a must try; perfect for the cold, damp Fall weather. The wait staff was attentive but not overly so. Great experience and we will definitely go back! Chef sent sample of butternut squash bisque to table...hope this on the menu the next time we go.

column4: 411 W. Franklin St. Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: Food is unbelievable. Best Italian food in town, by far.

We had a large party that could not be sat at one table. One of the managers went out of his way to find us adjoining booths with the same waitress so that we could order together and have just one bill. The food and service were excellent as always. My favorite is the seafood bisque and fried shrimp.

column4: 518 W. Jones St. West St. Raleigh, NC  27605
column13: Our first time at 518 for brunch. The food was excellent. The shrimp and grits were some of the best I've ever had. My mother in law had a salad topped with grilled salmon and stated the salmon was cooked perfectly. I also appreciate how well the server interacted with our 2-yr old!
Very nice restaurant in the Durham warehouse district. Has charm and appeal.
Great food; wine list isn't very big, but the food is great.

My wife and I ordered two entrees and they were outstanding. One entree was classic steak frites. The beef was a loin cut and cooked perfectly to order; the fries were done just right and were seasoned nicely. The other entree was venison sausage and wild boar over house-made papardelle. What a treat! The servings were more than ample and we ended up taking food home, but we're not complaining :-) I drank a pint of Triangle IPA and, in my opinion, it went better with the entrees than any wine would have. We split a slice of key lime pie for desert. It was also outstanding--very bright with lime juice flavor. I recommend skipping the whipped cream. Noise was better this time because we avoided being up front near the window seating
Beautiful setting; lots of room - tables well spaced. Excellent service

column4: 8411 Brier Creek Pkwy Suite 101 Raleigh, NC  27617
column13: Our third time dining here, and the best so far. Excellent service and wonderful food. Currently the best Indian restaurant in the area.

This was our first visit to Babylon and will definitely visit again. However, even though we told our server numerous times that we were in no rush that night for our entree and wanted some time in between our appetizer and entree, our request was ignored. Having said that we will surely go again but have learned to space out our order ourself. By the way the restaurant was not busy as that would have been an appropriate reason for feeling a little rushed. Please do not hesitate to try this restaurant....we can't wait to share our discovery with friends.

I came here for my birthday with a large party. Claire was our waitress and she was super attentive and knowledgable about the menu. Hand crafted cocktails were delicious. My sisters loved the Marie Claire and my brothers loved the beer selection. Overall, a wonderful dining experience. It was an absolutely wonderful place to celebrate.

column4: 1201 M Raleigh Rd. Chapel Hill, NC  27517
column13: Awesome food and wine to go with top shelf service...all working together!
Our party of 4 had a great time! We had wonderful wine, cocktails and loved all the food we ordered! The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about their menu. We'll be going back.

The chef personally came out and talked to my friend on her birthday! Great service- we had requested too spicy of food so the waiter offered to take it back and make it less spicy, overall excellent experience!

Our table of 5 was delighted with our meal. The hot and cold bars held choices for all of us. My sister especially liked the sushi and my mother, who is 92, fell in love with the shrimp bisque. The sweet raspberry dressing was a favorite of mine, adding a tangy topping to the salad. The meats brought to our table were hot, delicious, and plentiful, coming to our table in a timely fashion. Our reservation was for the last lunch seating so we were the only party in the restaurant. We received excellent attention from Benjamin, our server. We could not have asked for a more pleasant dining experience to celebrate my husband's birthday. We will return!!

very costly because we had to order several times to satisfy our appetites large plate is entree size small plate is like a saucer size really was disappointed we were not informed by our waitress. she did know it was our first time there.this was for my birthday and my husband was trying to make it very special...we left disappointed ..food was good but risotto was highly recommended by our waitress and when it arrived we couldn't eat it .. very strong .. the small plate dish of ... can't remember the name it had pulled pork on it pickled onion goat cheese i think was divine wish you offered it in a large plate entree size.
A little noisy for a romantic date, but the food is always excellent!

Dear Sir or Madam, We had brunch after the City of Oaks Half Marathon. There were two kids and six adults. When we walked in, exhausted and cold, the table was already set (with water glasses!!) and our waiter (I think his name was Jeff. It was his last day and he passed us off to someone else at the end, a lovely dark haired woman with a terrific smile) had coffee to us within seconds. The service was excellent, the food was incredible (I had huevos rancheros) and it was a wonderful experience. I have been to Cameron Bar and Grill several times and chose it as our post marathon brunch place. As always, it rose to the occasion! Terrific place, thanks for taking such good care of us!!
We had a table of 10.. Service was good and food was very good and hot. The specials were also special :)

column4: 6325 Falls of Neuse Road Raleigh, NC  27615
column13: best italian in raleigh, hands down

column1: Carolina Crossroads Restaurant at The Carolina Inn
column13: The food was less than exceptional. I suppose the word I would use would be bland. My sausage stuffed quail was very dry and while unique, unfilfilling.

column4: 905 West Main Street - Suite 115 Durham, NC  27701
column13: The food and service here are always amazing!

When I was planning how to celebrate the past thirteen years of marriage with my beautiful wife, Chef and the Farmer immediately came to mind. The online reservation process was fast and simple. They even allowed me to stop by the restaurant to view our reserved table and leave a vase of flowers and a card. That evening we sampled various wines recommended by our hospitable server. My wife's ribeye was cooked to perfection and I truly enjoyed the Wood Fired Shrimp, Clams & Oysters! I want to thank the team at Chef and the Farmer for a wonderfully romantic evening. For a couple of average folks, we were honored like royalty! We are definitely returning!-Brad Smith, La Grange, NC-
We love going to the Chef's Pallet. We even give gift cards to our friends from there. Always a good choice if you are looking for a special meal outside of the chain restaurants.

column4: 308 West Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: Authentic and best upscale Indian restaurant in Chapel Hill. One of my favorites.

column4: 201 South Estes Drive Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: The food was terrific and inventive! Unfortunately an Open Table reservation did not seem to mean much. We had the table near the kitchen, clearly nothing "reserved " about it. Happily for the restaurant, it was slammed...unhappily this meant the kitchen had trouble to keep up. Our waiter tried hard to compensate, and the bread and delicious dip did a great deal to keep us from gnawing on him or the table....will try again under less stressful conditions.

column4: 4351-119 The Circle at North Hills Raleigh, NC  27609
column13: Fantastic lunch menu for a good price. Quick service and back to work in a flash. Good place for a business lunch.
Food was very good. We had a group of 8.Prices were very reasonable

column4: 200 N Mangum St. Suite 101 Durham, NC  27701
column13: Dos Perros has fantastic food with exceptional service.A great dining experience for our group prior to Jersey Boys @ DPAC.Make a reservation and enjoy an evening with wonderful ambience and an outstanding dinner.
Very good food for a sports bar.

column4: 454 W. Franklin St Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: Very much enjoyed it overall. Service was very attentive. I thought the menu was interesting, but most of our food (she crab soup, grilled shrimp, sturgeon) was good, but not "WOW!". I don't mind a high bill if food, service, and environment are commensurate, but for our particular selections, I think the menu is overpriced. I'd be willing to give it another chance.
If you are looking for a place that has it all - atmosphere, food and service - this is it.

The food at Troy Mezza is always better than expected. Although not food I would eat every day, it is unique and a great break from the "standard fare". The wine list is good and has a great mix of affordable wines. The friends we dined with had never been to Mezza before and were a bit apprehensive at first but both really enjoyed both the food and the ambiance.
service a little slow at times but otherwise very enjoyable; also gluten-free friendly
Food average plus. Portions modest. VERY noisy. Very busy on a Sunday. Service average. Adequate, but nothing above the ordinary.
Excellence from amuse bouche to espresso. We tried the chef's tasting menu for a special celebration and every course was a delight.

We are a Navy football family and ate here back in 2010. It was a great dining experience then and on our short list for any visit to Greenville. Our 2012 dining experience was equally enjoyable and I would recommend Finnelli's without hesitation. Everyone was very friendly....even the Pirate fans! Go Navy Go Pirates.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Raleigh
column4: 4325 Glenwood Avenue #5004 - Crabtree Valley Mall Raleigh, NC  27612
column13: Had a great birthday celebration at Flemings. It is a little pricey but this time we had the best tasting filets that we ever had at Flemings. Unfortunately, our server didn't let us know ahead of time that the Lava Cake took 15 minutes to cook (other waitress's have before) so service was a bit slower than normal.

Four square was recommended to us as a "foodie" place, and it was obvious that that was what they were trying to be. They did a very good job at everything that a "foodie" place should. Ambiance, menu, service, culture, location, and romance were very much in line with what is expected. What was there and how I was treated was great, but I need to end with the following: the food was mediocre.

GREAT PLACE!!! THIS ONE HAS IT ALL!!!! Service so sweet! Food so good! Great for ANYTHING! !! We had never seen a bar-oriented place with OUTSTANDING FOOD before this. WOWOWOW!!! Looking for "somewhere good" to go at the spur of the moment, we saw this listing in Open Table. It is in our neighborhood, so we went for it. WOOOO-HOOOO!!! Were we glad we had!! Since this thing has a short character limit, I'll be brief. Everything was EXQUISITE.The cheese/meats.The soup (YUM).The hamburger??? YEAAAAA!!And then there was that scoop of rosemary/browned butter ice cream: LAY-DOWN-AND-DIE!! SO GOOD! GO TO THIS PLACE!

This restaurant would get 5 starts across the board if it weren't for the noise. I lowered my rating for ambience because of the noise. When the place is full, which it always is for dinner, it gets really loud.

The food and service were both excellent. The only oddity was that the valet took the time to remove and rearrange all the keys on my key ring. That's a little creepy. Otherwise, the restaurant was great!

column4: 1505 East Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: I treated my friend, who is a professional chef and restaurant reviewer, to a birthday lunch. She was impressed. The menu offered a variety of interesting dishes. We both chose the grilled chicken salad, and it was an elegant presentation. The pumpkin bread pudding for dessert came in a tiny iron skillet and was delcious. The wine list is extensive, but not overwhelming. Several wines are available by the glass.

column4: 327 West Davie St. Suite 102 Raleigh, NC  27601
column13: 3 of us had 3 different entrees and 2 desserts, and all were delicious. We were quite pleased to have delicious decaf coffee. Service was excellent.
Very friendly and knowledgable wait staff, food arrived quickly and was cooked perfectly.
Dinner was awesome. We were probably too early for the late-night scene, but the place was vibrant! Matt was our server, and very attentive, and very good. Loved every minute of the evening!
Our waiter provided outstanding service and our overall experience at La Volta was very good.

The service was great and the place is very nice but I'm extremely disappointed in the food. I had the poppers that were terrible. I love hot and spicy food but the poppers were not made correctly. They were barely stuffed with cheese and they were burnt. I asked the kind waitress if they made anything with sundries tomatoes for my entree and she suggested a chicken pasta. I have never eaten a piece of chicken that tasted like pure salt. There were no sun dried tomatoes in the pasta just "salsa" like tomatoes. I could make that pasta blind folded with better tasting ingredients at home. My husband got a steak. May I say that I'm very disappointed that a "grill" has no option for filets on the menu. Unfortunately outback has thicker juicier

Our second time. Very good appetizers and very creative menu, but main course needed additional seasoning. Due to a mixup, we were served our appetizers and main course simultaneously, but server was kind enough to comp us two beers.
Love the food, love the service.
It was a very nice evening. We had a great meal.

Six of us were there on a Friday night..Mantra felt more like a bar than a restaurant, and perhaps the owners agree by seemingly only staffing one server for the entire place. The service was SLOW and we could tell the server was stressed out trying to keep up with several large tables. This is in no way the service staff's fault. What makes up for that is the amazingly delicious food. It was incredible! I would go back, perhaps on a different weeknight, and just mentally prepare myself for the slow, spotty service.

We had a party of 7 and the service was great. Our server took care of us the entire night, right down to making sure no one had an empty water glass. The menu changes daily and every single thing we ordered was absolutely fantastic. Prices were reasonable and portion sizes were large enough to have leftovers to take home. We will DEFINITELY be going back, and bringing more friends!

column4: 109 W Chapel Hill St Durham, NC  27701
column13: I want to try this place again for sure: The food was fabulous. I think we hit a "quiet" night- It was election night and we went to eat there before hitting a later, louder election party.

column1: McCormick & Schmick's Seafood - Raleigh - Crabtree Mall
column4: 4325 Glenwood Avenue Crabtree Valley Mall - Suite 5008 Raleigh, NC  27612
column13: Very good experience will be back

Had a great time. I strongly recommend that you make reservations and don't just show up at their door step. You won't be happy. I saw four people turned away while we were there for that evening due to them not having a reservation. Dining takes about two hours from the time you enter till the time you leave. The food is very tasty and easy to work with. Our waiter (Ryan) was very helpful as we had never been there before and needed some guidance. The supporting wait staff was also very attentive. You can expect to pay something over a $100.00 for dinner for two plus tip.

If you want to go somewhere that has really good food and is good for groups and group celebrations, Mez is perfect. If you're looking for a place to eat and have a real conversation, not so much. Unfortunately we were meeting a couple we hadn't seen in 15 years, so we had a hard time having a conversation. But that's not what Mez is all about; it is vibrant and energetic and the food is really good. I must say that the hostess was really good about finding us the quietest table possible and our waitress was terrific all around. I would definitely return.

column4: 4100 Main At North Hills St Raleigh, NC  27609
column13: couldn't read the menu with the font used. Still needs some work. Food was ok Maggiano's is better food. Will try again We had a group of 8 people all felt the same about the food and menu.

The restaurant had plenty of folks at tables and at the bar but was by no means filled to capacity. Although my wife and I were only there for about an hour and fifteen minutes it seemed like we were there much longer than that. The food was good, not great, but good but the service was slower than I would have liked and the portions were not comparable to the price I paid for the meal. Truth be told, I'm not completely turned off by the place and I would go back with friends if that's where they wanted to go; I wouldn't volunteer it as my first choice though.

column4: 4121 Main at North Hills St, Ste 101 Raleigh, NC  27609
column13: Food was outstanding - fish was very fresh & beautifully prepared. Great sushi find.

This has by far, got to be the best restaraunt I'm Durham. Period. My aunt and uncle from NYC came into town to visit my husband and I and wanted to go to a restaraunt that was a little classier than the places we had originally decided to take them... I guess Tyler's taproom just didn't scratch their itch. I am so happy we decided to go there. This is now our go to restaraunt for special occasions. The food was outstanding and their wine list left nothing to be desired. Our server was excellent and very friendly and although the place was packed, the noise level was moderate, perhaps even low. Getting back to the food. I ordered the grouper (their menu changes each month) and no lie, it was the best fish I have ever had.

This was our first time there. It was a nice date night. Although the food was not great. And it was expensive for poor quality food. We had the wings. I have never seen such small over cooked with hardly any meat on them wings before. I dont think we will be going back for food anytime soon.

Excellent food and excellent service. Highly recommend this venue for a Sunday brunch and leisurely stroll through the exhibits - then head off to Duke Gardens to take in the sights there. Made for a great afternoon for us.

column4: 115 East St. James Street Tarboro, NC  27886
column13: we all had wonderful meals. Enjoyed by everyone in our party. What a real GEM ON the Square is!
Love the tapas style offerings. It does get cold if you sit near the door during a cold night. Service has always been good and the kitchen super fast.

My boyfriend and I went here on a whim, tired of eating at the same places. First off I'm a huge fan of BASS beer which is hard to find in bars around here. Not only did they have it here, but it was draft...Awesome (but expected for a british pub). I was skeptical of the french descriptions on the menu, but HOLY COW was the food great! We had the short ribs and the trout and it was way above par for "bar food." The place was pretty dead for dinner, so we moved to the bar after we ate and the bartenders were the friendliest around. There was supposed to be a live band after 1030 that night, so I may have given more stars if we'd been able to stick around that late...

First time to the Lafayette Village and first time to Paparazzi's. This was for our 4th wedding anniversary, and it was perfect! We were a little early, but we were seated and waited on with enthusiasm.and professionalism. We felt pampered and special for our special occasion, with a great recommendation for the wine and dessert. The reservation was made through OpenTable, and they noted the note I left about our anniversary and congratulated us sincerely.

This is truly a gem. It's a really good restaurant and serves good food. The waitress from Latvia though really needs to listen when diners are ordering. I asked for my Romesco sauce on the side and it came all over the plate. I should have just sent it back, but I was with a group.The desserts are good, but a little too decorated. The orange cake in itself is good it doesn't need vanilla/rasberry sauce and mounds of whipped cream to emblish it.It needs to be more simple so you can really enjoy the orange taste.

column4: 905 West Main Street - Ste 18A Durham, NC  27701
column13: Suprisingly terrific. The last time we went, it was just okay. This time was a frenetic evening (Duke parents' weekend); place was packed; we were there with 5 adults and a toddler in a high chair. Service was outstanding and very accommodating to the little person. Food was topnotch and came promptly; nice range of specials. Great Gelato for dessert...little one happy, adults happier! Overall good experience.
We had the chef's tasting menu and greatly enjoyed it. The risotto was excellent.

The Pit was a great experience! We had family visiting from MA who wanted to experience the "barbecue" experience and The Pit lived up to its' reputation. The food was excellent, plentiful and served quickly. The staff was exceptional! Prices were more than reasonable - we will definitely visit The Pit again!
It is a Chili's for rich people, but with better food.
The Porter's service is always responsive and quick, and the menu is varied enough to offer something for all taste buds.

It took some time for me and my wife to be seated. we ordered meatballs as appetizers and a lasagna and pizza as entree; food quality and flavor were very good. The place is amazing and really well put together in terms of decor, noise, etc..The bread took some time to get to the table, to the point where we had the appetizer but no bread..& when it did arrive it was a very small portion.Lasagna wasn't super hot but borderline cold. Prosciuto Pizza was delicious and tasted amazing with the Pinot Noir suggested by the waiter. We had Canoli for dessert and it was just OK, although the warm/soft version would've been better.Overall me and my wife enjoyed it, I'd definitely recommend.

We were a little concerned when we pulled up - the restaurant is in a non-descript strip mall next to an open lot. Walking in, we were greeted warmly and shown our table - the reservation was recognized and we had the place pretty much to ourselves. The beer & wine lists were expansive and reasonably priced. We shared an appetizer of the fried green tomatoes and it was agreed they were of exceptional quality, served piping hot with a spicy mustard dressing. For the main course we had the ribs, some brisket, roast chicken and the fish 'tacos' - all wer delicious although the fish tacos(not good for sharing). We closed the meal with bread pudding (delicious) and peach cobbler (doubly so) - hoping the sweet potato pie will be ready next time.

Love french food so was excited to try out a new french place (new to me). Great service. Really liked ambiance (old house). Really disappointed in the food. The bread and the dessert (profiteroles) were amazing. Didn't love the appetizer or entree. We had the escargot for an appetizer - it was tough and had no flavor. I had duck for dinner which I love. It was incredibly fatty. I know duck is a fattier meat but this was unetible. Unfortunately would not go again or recommend.
We had a group of 5 and it was perfect....It was quiet and we could talk and felt like it was private. Service was great! Loved the blue cheese dressing. Prices very reasonable.

column4: 137 E Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: Great service. The restaurant was hosting to large groups but that did not distract from them providing great service and exceptional food. Highly recommend the R&R burger and their flat bread pizzas.
My favorite. Great tasting menu.
Great and attentive service, delicious food. I will definitely go back.

column4: 6112 Falls of Neuse Rd. Raleigh, NC  27609
column13: Excellent food; wonderful service

column1: Shula's 347 Grill at the Sheraton Chapel Hill
column4: One Europa Drive Chapel Hill, NC  27517
column13: Service was excellent. Food was fantastic. This was my second time at Shula's 347 and a great experience was had both times. I'm surprised at how few patrons were there both times, this last being a Saturday evening. I think there were only 20 people dining.

Good as usually but frustrating that we had to wait over a half hour even with 9PM reservations. GM helped with some comps but it made for a long night. Still love the place and the downtown scene, but seemed to have some challenges juggling tables. May have been first cold night and people just hanging out vs. going to another location.
This was our first time dining at Solas although we had been to a rooftop party here once before.

Location was great - 3 blocks from Memorial Auditorium, and (since I don't eat sushi) - I was pleasantly surprised that my salad with teriyaki chicken was excellent! Everybody else in my group seemed to enjoy their sushi. Service was slow and miso soup mediocre.
Great food and atmosphere. Clients were impressed

column4: 456 West Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27516
column13: I've never had Turkish food - was mostly pleased. All our main entrees, including kabobs and the Saturday night special lamb dish, were delicious. I did not care for the hummous, which was loaded with uncooked cumin. Service was excellent. The restaurant was loud and tables are very close together. Overall, I would return, but maybe for lunch.

column4: 107 Edinburgh Drive South Suite 129 Cary, NC  27511
column13: Wonderful fried oysters! Not to be missed. Everything else (shrimp, tiny bay scallops, veggie sides, lobster) only acceptable--not memorable. Excellent server-- added a free dessert with candle for my birthday.
great burger, good service, pleasant evening, knew tgere were many TV's, but certainly did not go for them,
The pasta fiocchi is to die for!
They give us the best Upstairs-Balcony seats in the house as we made our reservations via OpenTable. WOW.

Used online reservation, but no one was aware of reservation and table was, therefore, not ready. When dialing phone #, only received recording to leave mesage, but does not identify the number or give details about call back, use online, or anything informative. Food was a little slow coming out and it was not a busy night.

column4: 306 D W. Franklin Street Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: nothing pretentious. but well-above-average dining, at a very reasonable price. Don't be put off by Vespa's location, with a cheap noodle place, a generic Mex and a Panera nearby, or by Vespa's namesake 1950's motorscooter in front of the door - that's just the way the street is, and none of these things reflect on the food or wine. Augmented by a good wine list, it's hard to do better than this neighborhood restaurant.
Always Great. My favorite restaurant in Raleigh.

My fiance and I dine at Vino several times per year and always enjoy it. The food and service are consistently good. This particular evening was a Sunday dinner outing, and we were very surprised at how few patrons were there. (We usually visit Vino on Saturday evenings, and it can be lively and sometimes a bit louder than we like.) The lack of activity resulted in a very nice, quiet dinner, and our waiter paid very close attention to keeping our drinks refreshed, etc. - very enjoyable.

Excellent food, classical mixed with traditional.. only comment would be that the Tira Misu was not good,nor authentic. It was very sweet with no taste of any liquor..perhaps you should write it as a "Tira Misu" styled dessert..
This was our first visit and the food was fantastic. We were planning our next visit while enjoying our 1st!

column4: 201 S Estes Drive @ University Mall Chapel Hill, NC  27514
column13: Didn't enjoy sitting in a booth at all. The table are oversized, I felt like I couldnt reach my food. But the food and service was very good.
Food lacked flavor all the way around. Not sure they make it there or just use frozen products. I think they could do better. Not sure I will give them a second chance.

The food was definitely a regional Indian style and was delicious. The Paneer was tasty and the Chicken Curry excellent. The Lamb Vindaloo was different from any other we had tasted, but good. The Cauliflower & Potato side dish was the best I have ever tasted and the Naans- both plain and cheese filled were exceptional.

Food was very good. Waitress was Great! Bartender was slow!!! One of the owners and chefs came out to a table next to us and spoke to them so we tried to offer our thoughts on his restaurant and food and were totally ignored!!! Would not speek or acknowledge we were even in the restaurant. WE WILL NOT BE BACK! Very RUDE!

Highly chic restaurant for li'll ol' Raleigh. The entrance and lighting makes you feel like you are going into another dimension. I give 100% on decore and ambiance. They truly have something unique there. As for service, we were told that we were stuck behind a group of 45. Well over 90 minutes to get our food. I have a hard time with such excuses. If you are going to accept a reservation for a group that large, have the staff to deal with it. Don't do it at the expense of your other guests. The food was okay; nothing to write home about but tasty. You are paying a premium for old standards like butter chicken served in cool vessles in a cool place. Yes, I will try them again. Hope its better next time.
